pull.title: rpc: Fail to return undocumented or misdocumented JSON
pull.body: This avoids documentation shortcomings such as the ones fixed in commit 56c4ac55f606cc37b30d5b68e155d4cc2b7c0c2c, e7b6272b305386a264adf2c04b7bebfb8499070f, 138d55e6a0241f126916fde6ac9177c7e2a119c4, 577bd51a4b8de066466a445192c1c653872657e2, f8c84e047c61200fae4cc1d85688e113bf270409, 0ee9a00f90e81a6978b30bdb250a37cbfa6da022, 13f41855c5fedf11d4a2525f2f0dd214533e5e62, or faecb2ee0a0ad3eb8303cfc84a87dc02ec553c43

issue.title: RPC documentation cleanup ideas
issue.body:
* Auto-formatting and sanity checking the RPCExamples with RPCMan
* Checking passed-in json in self-check. Removing redundant checks (RPCTypeCheck)
* De-duplicate default values (Started in #20017)
* Compile the RPC documentation at compile-time to ensure it doesn't change at runtime and is completely static

issue.title: MOVEONLY: Move wallet backup and encryption RPCs out of rpcwallet
issue.body: As part of an effort to split rpcwallet as per #23622, this moves `rpcdump.cpp` into the new wallet/rpc directory as well as moving backup and encryption RPCs out of rpcwallet.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
No conflicts as of last run.

issue.title: doc: Document optional RPC result fields
Split up rpcwallet
issue.body:
This is the rest of #23622, to split up rpcwallet into smaller, more logical parts.

This will have a lot of conflicts but let's just get it over and done with.

issue.title: doc: Add missing optional to MempoolEntryDescription
issue.body:
Needed for https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23083.

Can be reviewed with `--word-diff-regex=.`.

issue.title: doc: Add missing optional to getblockfrompeer
scripted-diff: Use named args in RPC docs
issue.body:
Incorrect named args are source of bugs, like #22979.

To allow them being checked by `clang-tidy`, use a format it can understand.

issue.title: doc: Mark proprietary array optional
issue.body: The global one is returned all the time, but the input/output array is returned optionally

issue.title: doc: Fix getblockchaininfo/getdeploymentinfo RPC docs
issue.body:
Also, fix whitespace to be `4` spaces. Can be reviewed with `--ignore-all-space --word-diff-regex=.`.

Found by https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23083

issue.title: rpc: Exclude descriptor when address is excluded
issue.body:
I don't think output descriptors should be used to describe redeem scripts and witness scripts.

Fix this by excluding them when it doesn't make sense.

This should only affect the `decodepsbt` RPC.

Found by https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23083

events.body: I opened this less than 6 months ago and this already found 7 bugs (see linked pulls and OP)

events.message:
rpc: Add m_skip_type_check to RPCResult

Used in the next commit.
rpc: Fail to return undocumented or misdocumented JSON

issue.title: Fix getpeerinfo doc
issue.body:
* Replace `node` with `peer`
* Remove unused `\n`
* Mark optional fields optional. See commit 9344697e57bd23d955df493d0581193ca1dc7cca, found by #23083

events.body:
ACK fc892c3a80091fbeaa2b5a6ec5bdaa31359b42de - tested that this catches issue, i.e #24691:
```bash
test_framework.authproxy.JSONRPCException: Internal bug detected: 'std::any_of(m_results.m_results.begin(), m_results.m_results.end(), [ret](const RPCResult& res) { return res.MatchesType(ret); })'
rpc/util.cpp:587 (HandleRequest)
You may report this issue here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues
 (-1)
```

This has been sitting catching bugs, too-long, to remain un-merged.

issue.title: Put undocumented JSON failure mode behind a runtime flag
issue.body:
Following the merge of https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23083, we'll throw a non-fatal error at runtime if the documentation for an RPC is incorrect. This behaviour has found numerous issues over a very short period (of the PR being opened). However, this is not something that we want in production / release builds, instead, we want the ability to have it enabled in the CI and when running tests. A runtime option could be added, which controls this behaviour (disabled by default).

#### Useful skills:

- C++
- Understanding of Bitcoin Core's initialization sequence
- Understanding of Bitcoin Core's RPC interface

#### Want to work on this issue?

For guidance on contributing, please read [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) before opening your pull request.
